benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client

Class CrimeSummaryActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client.CrimeActivityBase<CrimesSummary>
        • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client.CrimeSummaryActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CrimeDataLoadingListener<CrimesSummary>, CrimeOverviewFragment.OnShowCrimeListListener, KodUtvaruLoadingListener, OnCrimeSelectedListener, SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragment.SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragmentExceptionHandler, SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragment.SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogListener

    public class CrimeSummaryActivity
extends CrimeActivityBase<CrimesSummary>
implements OnCrimeSelectedListener, CrimeOverviewFragment.OnShowCrimeListListener
    CrimeSummaryActivity is the activity class used to display the summary of all crimes.

    For a given department and a crime data interval this activity displays the summary information about all committed crimes, like

    • the toplist of five most common crimes including a pie chart view visualizing the related data
    • crime index
    • crime solved ratio
    • crime trend

      The toplist and the pie chart display is handled by CrimeOverviewFragment, crime index, crime solved ratio and crime trend is displayed by BasicCrimeInfoFragment.

      The crime data type used to hold the information for the statistics is CrimesSummary.

    Author:
    Tom

    • Field Detail

      • mBasicCrimeInfoFragment

        private BasicCrimeInfoFragment mBasicCrimeInfoFragment
        the fragment used to display the basic crime statistics (crime index, crime solved ratio, crime trend)

      • mCrimeOverviewFragment

        private CrimeOverviewFragment mCrimeOverviewFragment
        the fragment used to display the crime toplist view and the related pie chart visualizing that toplist data

      • mCrimeTskMap

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,CrimeSummary> mCrimeTskMap
        the mapping of a TSK identifier value to the crime summary for the crime identified by that particular TSK identifier.

        It is used to resolve crime item selected by the user and identified by the TSK to the related crime summary object describing the summary information for that particular crime. The information retrived this way is used when navigating to that particular crime detail acitivity.

      • mTsk_IntentKey

        private final java.lang.String mTsk_IntentKey
        the string key for a TSK crime identifier intent extra
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OTHER_CRIMES_TSK

        private final int OTHER_CRIMES_TSK
        the special TSK crime identifier value used to denote the category of "other crimes"

        Other crimes are all the crimes that are currently not in the top N crimes displayed. It is essentially a hack to identify the special toplist item that is not meant to be used to navigate the user to the selected crime detail activity page.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Usually this is taken from the loaded crime data, but the default is to use this activity's title.

      • onCrimeSelected

        public void onCrimeSelected(int tsk)
        Called when a crime item is selected in the crime list view.

        The TSK identifier and the crime name is retrieved from a selected item and the user is navigated to the crime detail activity for the selected crime.

        The special case is handled by this method when the user selects the "OTHER" crime item. In this case the user is not navigated to the selected crime detail activity, the user selection (usually by a click) is ignored.

        Specified by:
        onCrimeSelected in interface OnCrimeSelectedListener
        Parameters:
        tsk - the TSK identifier of the selected crime
        See Also:
        CrimeDetailActivity

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Description copied from class: CrimeActivityBase
        Handles the options menu item selection.

        As a result, either the crime is refreshed, the crime data interval selection dialog is displayed or the used is navigated to a different activity to display an alternative crime statistics view.

        Overrides:
        onOptionsItemSelected in class CrimeActivityBase<CrimesSummary>
